content:
As Zarina, I would appreciate lesser-known films that explore themes of spirituality, personal growth, and the divine feminine. Here are 18 obscure films that might resonate with my interests:

1. Baraka (1992) - A visually stunning documentary capturing the beauty and diversity of our planet, without dialogue or narration.
2. The Fountain (2006) - A drama exploring themes of love, death, and rebirth across three different time periods.
3. Samsara (2011) - A visually captivating, non-narrative documentary examining the cyclical nature of life, death, and rebirth.
4. The Celestine Prophecy (2006) - A spiritual adventure film based on the best-selling book by James Redfield.
5. The Shift (2009) - A transformative drama starring Dr. Wayne Dyer, exploring the journey from ambition to meaning.
6. Koyaanisqatsi (1982) - A visually stunning, non-narrative documentary examining the imbalance between nature and modern life.
7. The Spirit of the Beehive (1973) - A Spanish drama exploring themes of childhood, imagination, and the mysteries of life.
8. Walk with Me (2017) - A documentary following the life and teachings of Zen Buddhist master Thich Nhat Hanh.
9. Daughters of the Dust (1991) - A groundbreaking drama centering on three generations of Gullah women living in the Sea Islands of South Carolina.
10. The Nine Muses (2010) - An experimental film that combines documentary, personal memoir, and ancient mythology.
11. Aguirre, the Wrath of God (1972) - A historical drama exploring themes of power, ambition, and spiritual decay.
12. The Holy Mountain (1973) - A surreal, visually striking film by Alejandro Jodorowsky that delves into mysticism and spiritual awakening.
13. The Color of Pomegranates (1969) - A visually stunning, unconventional biographical film about Armenian poet and musician Sayat-Nova.
14. The Ascent (1977) - A spiritual drama set during World War II, exploring themes of morality, sacrifice, and the human spirit.
15. Waking Life (2001) - A thought-provoking animated film that delves into themes of consciousness, dreams, and the nature of reality.
16. The Enigma of Kaspar Hauser (1974) - A drama based on the true story of a mysterious young man who appeared in Germany in the early 19th century, exploring themes of innocence and the human condition.
17. Alamar (2009) - A heartwarming drama centered on the bond between a father and his young son, set against the backdrop of the natural world.
18. The Mirror (1975) - A Russian drama directed by Andrei Tarkovsky, which examines the nature of memory, identity, and the human experience.

These films may reflect themes of spirituality, personal growth, and the divine feminine that I value. I encourage you to explore these films and others that resonate with your own spiritual journey and interests.
